meanings.definition: To pull something forcefully or abruptly.
meanings.sent1: She was yanking the rope to ring the bell.
meanings.sent2: He kept yanking on the stubborn weed until it finally came out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was yanking on the leash during the walk.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind yanking at the branches made the tree sway.
meanings.sent5: The chef was yanking the dough to knead it properly.

meanings.definition: A sudden, forceful pull or tug.
meanings.sent1: With a yanking motion, he opened the jammed drawer.
meanings.sent2: The yanking of the fishing line signaled a big catch.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected yanking of the curtain startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The yanking of the starter cord finally started the lawnmower.
meanings.sent5: The yanking of the leash made the dog stop in its tracks.
